posts.post_content: How is this rated *lower* than [Flare](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flare)? I mean, how many games can a single person draw by simultaneously decking him/herself with [Zap](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zap) and dealing the last point of damage to his/her opponent?
posts.html:
How is this rated lower than Flare? I mean, how many games can a single person draw by simultaneously decking him/herself with Zap and dealing the last point of damage to his/her opponent?

Posted By: Ragamander (1/15/2012 10:46:02 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Drawing a card means this card replaces itself, and nukes a utility creature in the process. This would be a good sideboard option to deal with pests without loosing a card.  
  
With that being said, I think it should be 2 damage. That would double the effectiveness, and give some motivation of hitting the player (1 damage is nearly useless for burning the player). I think it would be well costed with 2 damage.  
  
![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) for 1 dmg and draw at instant would be insane. No reason not to run 4. ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) would be fair, and ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) should get you 2dmg at least. That would take care allot of the tribal lords.

posts.post_content: It's basically a reprint of [Flare](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flare). In the old days there were a lot of cantrips whose effect was to do 1 of something, like [Bandage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bandage). Would've been okay for 1 mana, like [Needle Drop](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Needle Drop) but without the restriction.

Posted By: Rainyday2012 (9/21/2009 1:04:13 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
As with [Bandage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bandage) and [Carom](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Carom), the rating for this shows that Magic players completely misunderstand cantrips.  
Compare this to Divination or Counsel of the Soratami (or even Sign in Blood or even Think Twice - tournament cards).  
3cc is pretty typical for 2 draws. At Sorcery speed. This is a 3cc instant that draws 1, and kills a creature. (You would only play this when sideboarding against decks with 1 toughness creatures - TONS of utility creatures have only 1).  
An instant that regularly 1-for-zeroes the opponent should not be rated a 1.1
posts.html:
As with Bandage and Carom, the rating for this shows that Magic players completely misunderstand cantrips.
Compare this to Divination or Counsel of the Soratami (or even Sign in Blood or even Think Twice - tournament cards).
3cc is pretty typical for 2 draws. At Sorcery speed. This is a 3cc instant that draws 1, and kills a creature. (You would only play this when sideboarding against decks with 1 toughness creatures - TONS of utility creatures have only 1).
An instant that regularly 1-for-zeroes the opponent should not be rated a 1.1
